thread.title: Hamilton wins U.S. Grand Prix for third F1 title
thread.title_full: Hamilton wins U.S. Grand Prix for third F1 title

title: Hamilton wins U.S. Grand Prix for third F1 title
text:
Top News | Sun Oct 25, 2015 9:03pm GMT Hamilton wins U.S. Grand Prix for third F1 title AUSTIN, Texas Mercedes Formula One driver Lewis Hamilton of Britain races ahead of team mate Nico Rosberg of Germany during the U.S. F1 Grand Prix at the Circuit of The Americas in Austin, Texas, October 25, 2015. Reuters/Mike Stone 
AUSTIN, Texas Britain's Lewis Hamilton clinched his third Formula One world championship on Sunday after winning a thrilling and unpredictable U.S. Grand Prix for Mercedes. 
The 30-year-old became the first British driver to win back to back titles and also the first to win 10 or more races in successive seasons. 
Hamilton's German team mate Nico Rosberg, who started on pole, finished second after making a costly late mistake while leading. Ferrari's Sebastian Vettel took third place a mere 0.5 of a second behind. 
Hamilton had needed to beat Vettel by nine points and Rosberg by two to take the crown, but for much of the race it looked as if he would have to wait at least until Mexico next weekend. 
(Reporting by Alan Baldwin , editing by Martyn Herman)
